title: Executive Order 5482-Withdrawal of Public Lands Pending Legislation
content: It is hereby ordered that the lands hereinafter described be, and the same are hereby, withdrawn subject to valid existing rights pending legislation as provided by the act of June 25, 1910 (36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (37 Stat. 497):

T. 1 N., R. 23 E., sec. 2, NW. ¼ NW.¼;                            sec. 3, NW. ¼ NE. ¼, SE. ¼, NW. ¼ SW. ¼, SE. ¼ SW. ¼;                            sec. 9, NE. ¼ NW. ¼;                            sec. 10, NW. ¼, W. ½ NE. ¼.
T. 2 N., R. 23 E., sec. 26, S. ½ SW. ¼, W. ½ SE. ¼, SE. ¼ SE. ¼;                            sec. 35, NE. ¼, NE. ¼ NW. ¼, SE. ¼ NW. ¼, NE. ¼ SW. ¼, SW. ¼ SW. ¼, NE. ¼ SE. ¼, S. ½ SE. ¼, NW. ¼ SW. ¼.
This order shall continue in full force and effect unless and until revoked by the President or by act of Congress.
citation: Herbert Hoover, Executive Order 5482-Withdrawal of Public Lands Pending Legislation Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372971
